{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3499462,"name":"","username":"HawkBots","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hawkbots/{size}/209870_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T23:49:26.236Z","cooked":"

Hello! We are having problems with our swerve modules, specifically getting them to move in a predictable manner. We have our controller inputs correct, however the calculated vector components of our modules are all nonsensical as indicated by the blue arrows in the video linked below. Along with this, the wheels on our physical modules do not always match the angle or direction of the blue arrows. We are using the YAGSL template with MK4i L2 modules and NEOs. Any advice or potential solutions would be greatly appreciated!

Video Demonstration of the Issue in Web Components
Our Code on GitHub

There’s no video link target in your “Video Demo” link.

One thing to check is to be sure that you’ve set the units correctly on the dashboard if that’s what the video is showing. (I know this, because I did it wrong at first.) I forget if the default is radians on the dashboard, but if you mismatch degrees and radians, the dashboard looks wonky.

You were correct about the incorrect unit of measurement, and I have fixed that now. However, this did not solve the issue, and the dashboard still does not represent the actual position of the wheels.

I have re-added the video link, so you may be able to see it now.
